snippet: Eight California prison guards were acquitted today of federal charges that they entertained themselves by staging gladiator-style fights among inmates, including a brawl in which a prisoner was shot to death.    After six hours of deliberations, ...
lead_paragraph: Eight California prison guards were acquitted today of federal charges that they entertained themselves by staging gladiator-style fights among inmates, including a brawl in which a prisoner was shot to death. After six hours of deliberations, the jury found that the guards were not guilty of charges that they conspired to deny the prisoners their freedom from cruel and unusual punishment.
abstract: Eight guards at Corcoran State Prison in California are acquitted of charges that they entertained themselves by staging gladiator-style fights among inmates in 1994, including a brawl in which Preston Tate, a prisoner, was shot to death (S)

headline.main: Guards Acquitted of Staging Gladiator-Style Fights
